intro: Epidendrum phragmites, commonly known as the swamp hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and typically grows in wetland habitats such as swamps and marshes. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are often pink or red, with prominent stamens. Its roots are adapted to waterlogged soils, and it plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems. Epidendrum phragmites is also valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
